subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul asks, "Have I now become your enemy by telling you the truth? (Gal 4:16) NIV
reflection: The one thing we should notice in Paul's writings to the Galatians is that he did not gain great popularity when he rebuked them, for turning away from their first faith in Christ. I think that we would all have to agree that human nature hasn't changed much ~ we still get angry when we are scolded. But we shouldn't write off someone who challenges us. There may be truth in what he/she says. We should receive their words with humility, carefully thinking them over. When we discover that we need to change our attitude or actions, we should take steps to do so.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me by Your Holy Spirit, to make a close examination of my attitude and actions. Help me develop a more Christ-like attitude. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: It is for freedom that Christ has set us free. Stand firm, then, and do not let yourself be burdened again by a yoke of slavery. , , (Gal. 5:1) NIV
reflection: Christ died to set us free from sin and a long list of laws and regulations. Yes Christ came to set us free ~ but not free to do whatever we want because that would lead us right back into slavery to our selfish desires. Yes thanks to Christ, we are now free and able to do what was impossible to do before ~ to live unselfishly. Those who appeal to their freedom so that they can have their own way or indulge in their own desires are falling back into the slavery of sin. But we need to be careful that we do not put the burden of law keeping on Christians. We must stand against those who would enslave us with rules, methods, or special conditions for being saved or growing in Christ. Remember, "We are saved by grace alone ~ through faith alone."
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for sending Your Son Jesus Christ, to set me free from my sins. Help me to not use my freedom so as to become a slave again to sin.  Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Mark my words! I, Paul, tell you that if you let yourselves be circumcised, Christ will be of no value to you at all. Again I declare to every man who lets himself be circumcised that he is obligated to obey the whole law. You who are trying to be justified by law have been alienated from Christ; you have fallen away from grace. (Gal. 5:2-4) NIV
reflection: Trying to be saved by keeping the law and being saved by grace are two entirely different approaches."Christ will be of no value" means that Christ's provision for our salvation will not help us if we are trying to save ourselves. I know that I can in no way save myself, BUT Satan is always at my doorstep. Please remove the welcome mat when he is near. Amen.

verse: Paul says, "A little yeast works through the whole batch of dough." I am confident in the Lord that you will take no other view. The one who is throwing you into confusion will pay the penalty, whoever he may be. (Gal. 5:9, 10) NIV
reflection: Most generally when the word 'yeast' is used in the Bible it is referring to sin our evil. A little yeast causes the whole lump of dough to rise, means that it only takes one wrong person to infect all the others. This reminds me of what my uncle used to say, "You let the devil have you little finger and he will take your whole hand." Sin is an infectious disease, so remember to always take a healthy does of God's word each morning.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would always remember to take a healthy does of Your Word each and every day so that I would become more immune to sin. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: As for those agitators, I wish they would go all the way and emasculate themselves! You, my brothers, were called to be free. but do not use your freedom to indulge the sinful nature; rather, serve one another in love. (Gal. 5:12, 13).
reflection: What Paul is doing here is distinguishing between freedom to sin and the freedom to serve. Freedom or license to sin is no freedom at all, because it enslaves us to Satan, others, or our own sinful nature. Christians by contrast, should not be slaves to sin, because they are free to do right and glorify God through loving service to others.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, in Your loving mercy, forgive me for taking my freedom to extreme. Help me to use my freedom in loving service to You and others. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The entire law is summed up in a single command: "Love your neighbor as yourself." If you keep on biting and devouring each other, watch out or you will be destroyed by each other. (Gal. 5:14, 15) NIV
reflection: When we are not motivated by love, we become critical of others. We stop looking for the good in them and see only their faults. soon the unity of believers is broken. Have you talked about someone behind their back? Have you been focusing on the shortcomings of others instead of their strengths? You need to remind yourself of Jesus' commandment to love others as you love yourself (Mt. 22:39). When you begin to feel critical of someone, make a list of the person's positive qualities. If there are problems that need to be addressed, it is better to confront in love than to gossip.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be more tender hearted. Help me to speak in the most charitable way about my neighbor. Help me to always remember Your commandment, to love others as I love myself. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: So I say, live by the Spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of the sinful nature. For the sinful nature desires what is contrary to the Spirit, and the Spirit what is contrary to the sinful nature. They are in conflict with each other, so that you do not do what you want. (Gal 5:16, 17) NIV
reflection: How can we be certain if our desires are totally pure??? Well if your desires are to have the desires listed in Gal. 5:22, 23 then you know that the Holy Spirit is leading you. BUT at the same time, be careful not to confuse your subjective feelings with the Spirit's leading. Being led by the Holy Spirit involves the desire to hear ~ the readiness to obey God's Word ~ AND the sensitivity to discern between your feelings and His prompting. Live each day controlled and guided by the Holy Spirit. THEN the words of Christ will be in your mind ~ the love of Christ will be behind your actions ~ AND the power of Christ will help you control your selfish desires.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Holy Spirit's leading, and teaching, help me to always be sensitive to His presence. Help me to discern between my feelings and His prompting. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control. Against such things there is no law. (Gal. 5:22, 23)
reflection: The fruit of the Spirit is the spontaneous work of the Holy Spirit in us. The Spirit produces these character traits that are found in the nature of Christ. They are the by-products of Christ's control ~ we can't obtain them by trying to get them without His help. If we want the fruit of the Spirit to grow in us, we must join our life to His. (see Jn. 15:4, 5). We must know Him, love Him, remember Him, and imitate Him. As a result, we will fulfill the intended purpose of the law ~ to love God and our neighbors. Which of these qualities do you want the Spirit to produce in you?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, create in me a Christ-like spirit, help me to grow in humility and love. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Those who belong to Christ Jesus have crucified the sinful nature with its passions and desires. (Gal 5:24) NIV
reflection: In order to accept Christ as Savior, we need to turn from our sins and willingly nail our sinful nature to the cross. This doesn't mean, however, that we will never see traces of its evil desires again. As Christians we still have the capacity to sin, but we have been set free from sin's power over us and no longer have to give in to it. We must daily commit our sinful tendencies to God's control, daily crucifying them, and moment by moment draw on the Spirit's power to overcome them. (look to Gal. 2:20 and Gal. 6:14).
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that you would help me over-come my sinful tendencies. Help me become more and more sensitive to Your Spirit's power. Bless all my e-mail friends with good health and safety. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Since we live by the Spirit, let us keep in step with the Spirit. (Gal 5:25)
reflection: We need to keep in mind that God is interested in every part of our life, not just the spiritual part. As we live by the Holy Spirit's power, we need to submit every aspect of our life to God: emotional, physical, social, intellectual, vocational. Paul says that because we're saved, we should live like it!!! The Holy Spirit is the source of our new life, so we should keep in step with his leading. Don't let anything or anyone else determine your values and standards in any area of your life.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your loving presence in every area of my life. I thank You for Your Holy Spirit's guidance, help me keep in step with His leading. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Each one should test his own actions. then he can take pride in himself without comparing himself to somebody else, for each one should carry his own load. (Gal. 6:4, 5) NIV
reflection: When we do our very best, we feel good about the results. There is no need to compare ourselves with others. People make comparisons for many reasons. Some point out the flaws in others in order to feel better about themselves. others simply want reassurance that they are doing well. When you are tempted to compare, look at Jesus Christ. His example will inspire you to do your very best, and His loving acceptance will comfort you when you fall short of your expectations.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Forgive me for making comparisons with anybody else but You. Help me to model my life after Yours. I thank You again for Your love and mercy. Amen.

It is easy to receive the benefits of good Bible teaching and then take our spiritual leaders for granted, ignoring their financial and physical needs. We should care for our teachers, not grudgingly or reluctantly, but with a generous spirit, showing honor and appreciation for all they have done (I Tim. 5:17, 18).
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always remember the needs of my pastor so that I might truly share of the blessing I have received from You. Give me a more generous spirit I pray in Jesus name. Amen.

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Anyone who receives instruction in the word must share all good
things with his instructor... (Gal. 6:6) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul says, that as students of God's word it is our responsibility
to take care of the material needs of our teachers (I Cor 9:7-12).

It is easy to receive the benefits of good Bible teaching and then take
our spiritual leaders for granted, ignoring their financial and physical 
needs... 

We should care for our teachers, not grudgingly or reluctantly, 
but with a generous spirit, showing honor and appreciation 
for all they have done (I Tim. 5:17, 18).

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always remember 
the needs of my pastor so that I might truly share of
the blessing I have received from You. Give me a more 
generous spirit I pray in Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up, that you may receive, 
a more generous spirit...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

verse: Do not be deceived: God cannot be mocked. A man reaps what he sows. The one who sows to please his sinful nature, from that nature will reap destruction; the one who sows to please the Spirit, from the Spirit will reap eternal life. (Gal. 6:7, 8) NIV
reflection: It would certainly be surprising if we plant corn and pumpkins came up. it's a natural law that we reap what we sow. It's true in other areas too. If you gossip about friends, you will lose their friendship. Every action has results. If you plant to please your own desires, you'll reap a crop of sorrow and evil. If you plant to please God, you'll reap joy and everlasting life. let us examine closely the kind of seeds we have been sowing!
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for all my ill planted seeds. I truly want to plant seeds which are pleasing to You because I want to reap joy and everlasting life. Bless all my e-mail friends today with safety and good health. Amen.

reflection: I believe we have all found it to be discouraging to continue to do what is right when we receive no words of thanks or see any tangible results. Help me to trust in Your timing I pray in Jesus name. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Those who want to make a good impression outwardly are trying to compel you to be circumcised. The only reason they do this is to avoid being persecuted for the cross of Christ. Not even those who are circumcised obey the law, yet they want you to be circumcised that they may boast about your flesh. (Gal. 6:12, 13) NIV
reflection: Some of the Judaizers were emphasizing circumcision as proof of holiness ~ but were ignoring the other Jewish laws. People today too often choose certain principle or prohibitions and make them the measure of faith. Some may frown on drunkenness but ignore gluttony. Others may despise promiscuity but tolerate prejudice. The Bible in its entirety is our rule of faith and practice ~ We cannot pick and choose the mandates we will follow.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always remember, sin is sin ~ whether the act is tolerable or horrendous, in God's eyes it is still s-i-n. Help me to examine my own actions before I pass judgement on others. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: May I never boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world. (Gal. 6:14) NIV
reflection: The world is full of enticements. Every day we are confronted with subtle cultural pressures. The only way to escape these destructive influences is to ask God to help crucify our interest in them, just as Paul did. How much do the interest of this world matter to you? My suggestion is to read Gal. 2:20 and 5:24 for more on this concept.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for the times I have fallen prey to the influences of the world. Help me to crucify my interests in them. Amen.
